command: docker run --rm -v appdata:/target ubuntu bash -lc 'find /target -xdev -type f -print0 | xargs -0 -r shred -n 3 -z -u; sync'
explanation: Mounts the Docker volume 'appdata' into a temporary Ubuntu container and irreversibly overwrites every file with multiple passes using shred, then deletes them and flushes writes.
rationale_steps: Mount the target Docker volume into a helper container
Enumerate files safely with null delimiters
Overwrite each file with multiple passes and zero-fill using shred
Unlink files post-overwrite and sync to flush to disk
